title: super_mario_sunshine
body:
A game in the [i][[Mario (series)|]][/i] series released on the [[GameCube|Nintendo GameCube]] in 2002, where [[Mario]] visits the tropical Isle Delfino. Mario must clean the island with his newfound water pack [[F.L.U.D.D.]] after being framed by the impostor [[Shadow Mario]].

h4. Characters
h5. Main
* [[Mario]]
** [[Mario (Sunshine)]]
* [[F.L.U.D.D.]]
* [[Princess Peach]]
** [[Princess Peach (Sunshine)]]
* [[Shadow Mario]]

h5. Mounts

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

title: pantyshot_through_reflection
body: A specific type of [[pantyshot]] caused by the wearer being near a [[reflection|reflective]] surface, such as [[reflective water|water]].

title: waluigi_(super_rush)
body:
[[Waluigi]] wearing his attire from [i][[Mario Golf: Super Rush]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Headwear[/b]: A purple fedora with white band around it, adorned with a red rose on the side.
* [b]Top[/b]: A snazzy, golf-inspired outfit. A striped, long-sleeve shirt (vertical gray-and-white stripes) is worn underneath. Over the shirt, he wears a purple vest with gold-colored buttons. The vest is slim-fitting, with a V-neck that reveals the shirt collar and stripes.
* [b]Glove[/b]: A single purple-and-white golf glove.
* [b]Botttoms[/b]: Matching purple trousers continue the color scheme, fitting rather snugly.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: His golf shoes are predominantly purple and white, tying in with the rest of his outfit. They have cleats and resemble [[saddle shoes]].

title: hoshino_akira
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Miyamoto Issa]]. She is one of the main female protagonists in their trilogy [[doujinshi]], Heart Mark Oome.

She is a friend of Yuu's who likes anime and manga, she also learns that his [[Saigawara Reika|sister]] is an ero-manga artist whom she's a fan of. She soon has [[sex]] with Yuu, and joins in [[threesome]]s with him and his sister.

[b]Akira[/b] has [[dark skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

title: rosalina_(ultra_smash)
body:
[[Rosalina]] wearing her attire from [i][[Mario Tennis: Ultra Smash]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A sleeveless turquoise/sky-blue tennis dress with a slight flare at the hem. It has a simple round neckline. The skirt of the dress is short and ruffled. On her chest is a prominent star-shaped brooch or jewel, matching her usual star motif.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White tights (or leggings).
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Aqua shoes with a white toe cap.

title: choker
body:
A tight-fitting cloth band worn around the neck.

It's sometimes also worn in [[BDSM]] in place of a more traditional [[collar]].

Not to be confused with [[choking on object|choking]], which is a type of [[asphyxiation]], or with a [[collar]], which is usually made of thicker material and not as tight-fitting.

title: rosalina_(super_rush)
body:
Rosalina wearing her attire from [i][[Mario Golf: Super Rush]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A short-sleeved collared aqua golf dress with a layered skirt. The outer skirt layer is aqua, and underneath it is a white layer. On her chest is a small star-shaped emblem.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White tights/leggings.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: White athletic golf shoes with aqua accents.
* [b]Glove[/b]: A single aqua golf glove.

title: princess_peach_(toadstool_tour)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] wearing her attire from [i]Mario Golf: Toadstool Tour[/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A sleeveless pink dress. The bottom hem of the dress features a decorative scalloped pattern.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White socks that come up just above her ankles (nearly mid‐calf).
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Red shoes with a pink toe cap.

Notably, this outfit has extensive use outside of its debut game, appearing in [i][[Mario Power Tennis]][/i], [i]SSX on Tour[/i], [i][[Mario Golf: World Tour]][/i], and many other spin-off titles.

title: back_to_the_future_part_ii
body:
The 1989 sequel to the 1985 film [[Back to the Future]] and the second installment in the Back to the Future franchise.

It follows [[Marty McFly]] and his friend [[Emmett Brown|Dr. Emmett "Doc" Brown]] as they travel from 1985 to 2015 to prevent Marty's son from sabotaging the McFly family's future. When their arch-nemesis [[Biff Tannen]] steals Doc's [[DeLorean]] [[time machine]] and uses it to alter history for his benefit, the duo must return to 1955 to restore the timeline.
other_names: バック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャー2
バックトゥザフューチャー2

title: back_to_the_future_part_iii
body: Back to the Future Part III is a 1990 American science fiction Western film and the third installment of the [[Back to the Future]] trilogy. The film was directed by Robert Zemeckis, and stars Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen, Thomas F. Wilson, and Lea Thompson. The film continues immediately following [[Back to the Future Part II]] (1989).

title: acrylic_stand_(object)
body:
A cutout image, typically of a character, affixed to a clear acrylic board and held up using a base. They're similar to a [[cardboard cutout]] but smaller, and commonly sold as goods similar to character [[figure]]s.

Use this tag when the acrylic stand is [b]an unimportant item in the illustration[/b]. If the medium of art is an acrylic stand, please use [[acrylic stand (medium)]].

title: princess_peach_(tennis_64)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] wearing her attire from the Nintendo 64 video game [[Mario Tennis (Nintendo 64)|Mario Tennis]]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A short pink dress with puffy short sleeves. There’s a lighter pink shade that makes up the main part of the skirt and a darker pink band or trim around her waist area.
* [b]Jewels[/b]: A large, round blue jewel in the center of her chest, matching her round blue earrings.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White socks that come up to about mid-calf.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Orange tennis shoes with a thin band near the soles.

title: gundam_barbatos
body:
[b]ASW-G-08 Gundam Barbatos [/b]

The mascot [[mecha|mech]] of [[gundam tekketsu no orphans|Gundam Iron-Blooded Orphans]]. Its signature weapon is a very large [[mace]].

Use this tag for the Gundam Barbatos and its in-story upgrades: the Gundam Barbatos Lupus, and the Gundam Barbatos Lupus Rex.

It is piloted by [[Mikazuki Augus]].

title: gundam_kimaris_vidar
body:
[b]ASW-G-66 Gundam Kimaris Vidar[/b]
A refit of the mighty [[Gundam Kimaris]], increasing its power even further via the addition of a special Alaya-Vijnana System that enabled its pilot, the mysterious Vidar, to operate the machine to the fullest of its potential.

[spoiler]Utilizing the remains of [[Ein Dalton]]'s brain for control, this meant Vidar, aka [[Gaelio Bauduin]], was able to abuse the Alaya-Vijnana without incurring any damage to his brain - in fact, the implant ended up helping him with his disability.[/spoiler]
other_names: ガンダム・キマリスヴィダール

title: v2_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]LM314V21 Victory 2 Gundam[/b]

An upgraded version of the [[V Gundam]] incorporating the V2 Core Fighter, loaded with a powerful Minovsky drive capable of pushing the [[mobile suit]] to suicidal accelerations of up to 20G. 

The exhaust plumes of the Minovsky drive often were released as the "Wings of Light", which served both as deadly offensive weapons and absolute shields, and the unit itself could be fitted with extra hyper beam cannons, variable speed beam rifles, I-Field generators, and a mega beam shield using the Buster and Assault optional armament sets.
 
It could also load all of them at once, creating a new, almost invincible configuration known as the [b]LM314V23/24 [[V2 Assault-Buster Gundam]][/b]. It was piloted almost exclusively by the League Militaire's ace, [[Uso Ewin]].

title: gundam_bael
body:
[b]ASW-G-01 Gundam Bael[/b]
The original Gundam Frame created during the Calamity War to fend off against the Mobile Armors. Bael was an all-round balanced MS that possessed no specific strengths nor weaknesses - however, after the war, its mighty symbolism among Gjallarhorn (it was assumed that Bael rejected commands and only the "righteous heir of Gjallarhorn" could successfully control the unit) meant that once it was obtained by [[McGillis Fareed]], who managed to pilot it, his political power grew exponentially.

title: ezo_red_fox_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park, being part of the Snowy Mountain Region in the anime.

As her name suggests, she is an [[Ezo Red Fox]] ([i]Vulpes vulpes schrencki[/i]), a red fox subspecies native to Hokkaido and Sakhalin.

Her outfit consists of what appears to be an orange blazer uniform with fur lined sleeves and a white pleated skirt, beige pantyhose fading to white at the feet, black gloves as well as a scarf tied into a bow. She has long blonde hair with black-tipped bangs along with the requisite fox ears and tail. She can be distinguished from a simple palette swap of Silver Fox with her lack of sidelocks. Her eyes are also a lighter amber color than her fellow fox.

More often than not, she is depicted as a slacker who likes to play video games.

She is often seen with [[Silver Fox (kemono friends)|]], a fellow fox Friend. Compare as well with [[Red Fox (kemono friends)|]], their nominate species Friend.
other_names: キタキツネ(けものフレンズ)

title: shoebill_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park, being part of the Prairie Region.

[[Shoebill]]s ([i]Balaeniceps rex[/i]) are stork-like birds known for - as their names suggest - their shoe-shaped beaks.

h5.Appearance
* [[long hair|Long]] [[multicolored hair]] consisting of [[grey hair|grey]], [[black hair|black]], and light [[orange hair|orange]]
* Hair is fashioned with a [[sidelocks|lock of hair]] on her left side that resembles a shoebill's beak.
* Her [[bangs]] form a neat point [[hair_between_eyes|between her eyes]], partially occluding them and exaggerating [[tsurime|her piercing gaze]].
* Has [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[bird wings]] [[head wings|on her head]] and a [[bird tail]]
* She appears to be wearing either a unitard or a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[grey shirt]] with [[grey shorts]]
* Has a [[grey necktie|grey]] or [[white necktie]] and [[belt]] while her outfit has many [[pocket]]s
* [[black gloves|Black]] [[fingerless gloves]]
* Please note that she's wearing a silver [[bodystocking]] under her outfit and not just [[pantyhose]]

title: enoshima_electric_railway
body:
The Enoshima Electric Railway or Enoshima Dentetsu Line (江ノ島電鉄, Enoshima dentetsu), also known by the abbreviation Eno-den (江ノ電), is a Japanese railway which connects Kamakura Station in [[Kamakura (city)|]] with Fujisawa Station in Fujisawa, Kanagawa. Known for being the main railway access to the Sitting Buddha at Koutoku-in Temple (near Hase station), [[Enoshima]] island in Fujisawa, and the [[railroad crossing]] at Kamakura Koukou-mae station that directly faces the Pacific Ocean (as seen in [i][[Slam Dunk (series)|]][/i], [[Seishun Buta Yarou]] and [i][[Tari Tari]][/i]). 

H4. Logo
* !asset #23483570: Enoden Logo

* !post #4392845: An Enoden [[Streetcar]] crossing Kamakura Koukou-mae [[railroad crossing]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enoshima_Electric_Railway]

title: inu-oh
body: A 2021 animated musical fantasy film directed by Yuasa Masaaki and produced by Science SARU. Based on the novel [i]Tales of the Heike: Inu-Oh[/i] by Furukawa Hideo, the film follows the blind biwa player [[Tomona (inu-oh)|]] (who also takes the names Tomoichi and Tomoaru) and the deformed dancer [[Inu-Oh (inu-oh)|]] as they perform unconventional, anachronistic concerts in 14th century Japan.

title: maeda_chihiro_(animator)
body:
Animator.

Her given name 千景 has the uncommon (but not unheard of) reading [i]chihiro[/i], and most sources gives the more common (but probably wrong) reading [i]chikage[/i].
Post #6718095 and post #6718070 from [[Newtype]] are attributed to a certain "CHIHIRO MAEDA" from [[Kinema Citrus]].
Only one Maeda from [[Kinema Citrus]] could be found, namely 前田千景. Which means that 前田千景, most probably, is Maeda Chihiro's name in kanji.

title: akira_(kadokawa)
body:

Nothing else seems to be known about him/her (or if Akira is more than one person, as there seems to be heavy shifts in style between art).

The credits for KanColle Kai lists her real name as Oikawa Mayu.

title: syringe
body:
A syringe is a simple piston pump consisting of a plunger that fits tightly in a tube. This tag is used to describe a hypodermic needle, which is a hollow needle commonly used to inject substances into the body or used to take liquid samples from the body. However, the needle portion itself need not be present for the tag to qualify.

Syringes are called needles in some areas of the world, but on Danbooru, [[needle|needles]] refer to the thin stick of pointed metal used for [[sewing]] or as weapons.

Use of syringes may cause [[track marks]].

h4. See also

* [[Holding syringe]]
* [[Large syringe]]
* [[Injection]]
* [[Doctor]]
* [[Nurse]]

title: injection

body:
A [[playboy bunny]] suit that is accompanied by [[tactical clothes]], such as [[thigh holster]]s, [[ammunition pouch]]es, [[headset]]s, tactical jackets, and other tactical or [[military]] gear. The focus should be upon a (roughly) equal blend of both military hardware and the playboy bunny aesthetic.

Basically, the vibes are: if it looks like the person wearing the playboy bunny outfit is not only going to the photoshoot, but is also going to fight their way [i]out[/i] of the photoshoot with their guns and kit, then this tag is valid.

h4. Examples

* !post #5619628: Has magazine pouches, tactical belts, and holsters.
* !post #6085232: A playboy bunny outfit with additional tactical kit on top.
* !post #5881867

h6. Invalid Examples

* !post #5340134: Does not count because the gun is essentially a "prop" that the character has.
* !post #7471036
* !post #4674534

h4. See also

* [[tactical maid]]
* [[tactical school uniform]]

Distinct from [[military combat uniform]] by having much less [[camouflage]] or none, as well as different [[insignia]].

title: military_operator
body:
A [b]special forces[/b] (derived from [i]special operations forces[/i]) is an elite [[military]] [[soldier|infantry]] unit being tasked for risky or demanding operations by the government or the army. An individual served in the special forces are known as a "military operator", or "operator" for short.

This tag covers images with military operator(s) armed with "tactical" [[gun|firearms]] (which may consist of prototype or advanced [[weapon]]s, especially those with the various mounted accessories such as [[laser sight|laser sighting system]], [[optical sight]]s and/or [[suppressor]]s). They are also usually seen equipped with [[tactical clothes|tactical]] loadout that may consist of [[ghillie suit]]s, [[bulletproof vest]]s, [[camouflage]]d [[military uniform]]s, [[helmet]]s, [[night vision device]]s, [[radio]]s and more. 

Certain SOF groups, such as the US Green Berets, British [[Special Air Service|SAS]], and Soviet/Russian [[Spetsnaz]] (also [[VDV]]), can be distinguished by coloured [[beret]]s. These are, respectively, green berets, red berets, beige berets and blue [[military hat|berets]].

h4. See also

* [[body armor]]
* [[load bearing vest]]
* [[sniper team]]
* [[tactical clothes]]
* [[trigger discipline]]

title: bismarck_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Bismarck[/i]. Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey shirt|grey]] [[sleeveless shirt]] worn under a [[black shirt]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[brown gloves]], [[grey thighhighs]], [[grey collar]] with an [[anchor]], [[grey boots]], and a [[grey hat|grey]] [[peaked cap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a funnel-and-mainmast piece to her back, linking a half-circle hull containing all four of her 38 cm twin gun mounts and two 15 cm twin gun mounts, with the turret colors changing per remodel form. She also gains 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] at [[Bismarck drei (kancolle)|Drei]]/Kai San form.

title: venom:_the_last_dance
body:
Venom: The Last Dance is a 2024 American superhero film written and directed by Kelly Marcel, which features the [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] character [[venom (marvel)|Venom]]. The final installment of the Venom trilogy following [[Venom (2018)]] and Venom: Let There Be Carnage (2021), it is the fifth film in [[Sony's Spider-Man Universe]] (SSU) and stars Tom Hardy as Eddie Brock and Venom, alongside Chiwetel Ejiofor, Juno Temple, Rhys Ifans, Stephen Graham, Peggy Lu, Clark Backo, Alanna Ubach, and Andy Serkis.

h4. External links

title: venom_(2018)
body:
Venom is a 2018 superhero film based on the [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] [[venom (marvel)|character of the same name]]. The first film in [[Sony's Spider-Man Universe]] (SSU), it was directed by Ruben Fleischer from a screenplay by Jeff Pinkner, Scott Rosenberg and Kelly Marcel, and stars Tom Hardy as Eddie Brock and Venom, alongside Michelle Williams, Riz Ahmed, Scott Haze, and Reid Scott. In the film, Eddie, a struggling journalist, gains superpowers after becoming the host of Venom, an alien symbiote whose species plans to invade Earth.

h4. External links

title: spider-man:_into_the_spider-verse
body:
A 2018 animated film in [[Marvel]]'s [[spider-man (series)|Spider-Man]] series, loosely based on the Spider-Verse event from the comics. As in the source material, the film follows a story in which spider heroes from multiple different universes are brought together to stop an interdimensional threat. It notably uses a variety of art and animation styles to highlight the differences in the worlds each hero comes from. The movie is also notable for being [[Miles Morales]]' first film appearance.

The movie was a massive success, winning the Academy, Annie, and Golden Globe Awards for Best Animated Feature, and creating a wave of interest in a live-action adaptation of the Spider-Verse comic.

A sequel titled [I][[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]][/I] is set to release in June 2023, and a spin-off film focused around female spider heroes titled [i]Spider-Women[/i] is planned to release in the future. Several TV series spin-offs based on the characters are currently in production as well.

h1. Characters

The outfit consists of a [[blue bandeau|blue]] [[bandeau]]/[[crop top]] and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]] worn over [[white panties|white]] [[highleg panties]] with yellow and white accents, a [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]] with a [[checkered clothes|checkered pattern]] at the front, [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], and white [[thigh boots]] along with a [[headset]] consisting of a pair of [[headphones]] and an attached [[microphone]]. Also seen in the official art are a white [[winter jacket]] that she handles rather than wears and a green and white umbrella, both of which are optional.

Later became [[Gotland_(kancolle)_(cosplay)|a popular cosplay item]] wherein the main and accent colors of the outfit are oftentimes changed, from blue and yellow respectively, to suit the cosplaying character.

title: houmonka
body: As its first step, Suì-Fēng stabs her enemy with Suzumebachi's blade. In addition to creating a rather deep wound, the attack leaves a butterfly-shaped stamp on the victim’s body. Spreading from the center of the wound, known as Hōmonka, this stamp becomes the target of Suì-Fēng's second attack. If struck in the same spot that was hit the first time, the person will inevitably die, and thus illustrate "Death in Two Steps.

title: robbery
body:
The criminal act of [[theft|stealing]] from others with [[threat]]s of violence, usually using weapons and/or verbal threats.
It can be applied to a location (bank, office) or a person (people walking the street, family in their home).

While circumstances may vary, the main motive has to be money, valuables, or property.

If the character in question is stealing from others in secret, use the tag [[burglar]] instead.

title: fujoshi
body:
Literally translated as [b][i]rotten girl[/i][/b], it refers to a female fan of [[yaoi]]. 

It should be noted that the concept of "yumejoshi" (a girl who enjoys imagining herself in a relationship with a fictional character, often through drawing and writing) has also come into use, though this is less common.

While the term [[otaku]] could be used for males and females, fujoshi specifically identifies females. Male fans of yaoi are called [[fudanshi]] instead. The equivalent words for overzealous fans of [[yuri]] are [[himejoshi]] and [[himedanshi]].

h4. See also

* [b]Yaoi or yuri fans[/b]
** [[Fudanshi]]
** [[Himejoshi]]
** [[Himedanshi]]

title: ro-500_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine Ro-500, the ex-[[U-511 (kancolle)|]]. Nicknamed "Ro". Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[tan]]. Her Japanese service outfit consists of a [[school swimsuit]], a cropped white [[serafuku]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[grey sandals]], a [[hair flower]] (a "satsuki azalea":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satsuki_azalea], reference to her code name of "Satsuki 1-go"), and a [[bracelet]]. She is seen holding a [[lifebuoy]] and a [[torpedo]] strapped to her as her only [[rigging]]. 

Often portrayed in fanart with [[i-58 (kancolle)|I-58]] due to her 10:00 hourly line where she calls I-58 "Decchi", I-58's verbal tic, thinking it's her nickname instead of Gouya, making I-58 mad. Upon being acquired by Japan, U-511, now RO-500, did not score any kills or have a combat record; she was instead kept for analysis by the IJN for their late-war submarines.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3319090: Default
* !post #3258368: [[Ro-500 (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: German submarine U-511":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_submarine_U-511
* "Combined Fleet: U-511/RO-500":http://www.combinedfleet.com/RO-500.htm

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into [[twintails]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default (and only) outfit consists of a [[black bikini]] with the top as a [[bandeau]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[black gloves]] with the [[Sakura Empire (emblem)|]] emblem printed on it, and a [[white belt]].

title: u-511_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German submarine U-511. Nicknamed "Yuu". Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She has [[long hair|long]] light [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey hat|grey]] [[garrison cap]] with her hull number print plus [[periscope]] and fins, [[grey jacket|grey]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black dress]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bow split into two halves, one on either side, and her real-life deck gun as a [[handgun]]. 

She speaks in a soft, quiet voice. She mentions in lines about how she is getting used to Japanese culture and the Japanese language, on account of historical transfer to Japan as [[RO-500 (kancolle)|]].

title: fbi_open_up_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] that references the [[fbi|Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)]]. The quote "FBI, open up!" is often used to humorously call out suspicious or inappropriate behavior, especially in online communities, especially pertaining [[pedophile]]s.

These memes are often accompanied by a clipped moment from a "skit":[https://youtu.be/c46_iL2QqOE]by Australian comedy [[YouTube|YouTuber]] "RackaRacka":[https://www.youtube.com/@Therackaracka], featuring a special police unit responding immediately to a smoke bomb setting off at a dull house party by violently breaking in to the home, causing chaos and destruction.

title: eroge_sekai_ni_tensei_shita_ore_ga_oshi_e_no_ai_de_netorare_heroine_o_shiawase_ni_suru.
body:
[b]Eroge Sekai ni Tensei Shita Ore ga, Oshi e no Ai de Netorare Heroine o Shiawase ni Suru.[/b] (エロゲ世界に転生した俺が、推しへの愛で寝取られヒロインを幸せにする。, lit. [i]I, Who Was Reincarnated into the World of Eroge, Will Make the NTR Heroine Happy with My Love.[/i], abbrev. [i]TenHero[/i]) is an ongoing Japanese web comic, written by Mizuki Mizushiro and illustrated by [[Satsuki Asha]]. It's being serialized in [i]Comipo[/i] since July 13, 2023, with three Volumes released as of February 2025.

The story follows Mitsuki, a college students who gets roped by a friend into playing an erotic game, [i]Hanaguri[/i], and promptly falls head over heels in love with the game's main heroine, [[Sakura Kotoha|Kotoha]]... But, the harsh truth is that he has been duped: Hanaguri is a NTR game disguised as a pure-love dating game, in which all the heroines are seduced by the player's best friend, Ryou.
While searching for a happy ending with Kotoha, Mitsuki accidentally falls onto the train platform. When he wakes up, he finds himself reincarnated as Kouki, the player character of Hanaguri!
With his vast knowledge of the game, and deep love for Kotoha, Mitsuki is determined to change fate this time.
In order to protect Kotoha and the others from Ryou, he must achieve a perfect happy ending.
other_names: エロゲ世界に転生した俺が推しへの愛で寝取られヒロインを幸せにする。

The skirt portion flares out slightly and has a scalloped white hem, decorated with small circular details. The bodice of the dress features a large white flower emblem around a blue jewel at the center of her chest.

title: help:api
body:
Danbooru offers a REST-like API to make scripting easy. All you need is a way to GET, POST, PUT and DELETE to URLs. Responses are given in either XML or JSON format.

h1. Testing

API calls can be tested on https://testbooru.donmai.us. Scripts should be tested there before using them on the main site.

h1. Basics

HTTP defines four basic request methods: GET, POST, PUT and DELETE. You'll be using these methods to interact with the Danbooru API. Most API calls that change the state of the database (like creating, updating, or deleting something) require an HTTP POST, PUT or DELETE call. API calls that only retrieve data can typically be done with an HTTP GET call.

A URL is considered a resource and the HTTP methods are actions you perform on the resource. For example, GET "/posts/23.json":/posts/23.json returns a JSON representation of post #23. GET "/posts/23.xml":/posts/23.xml returns an XML representation. PUT or PATCH /posts/6.json would update the resource, for example changing its tags.

Some resources require parameters. For example, you can find tags that start with the letter 'a' by calling GET "/tags.json?search[name_matches]=a*":/tags.json?search[name_matches]=a*. This will give you a JSON listing of all tags with names starting with an a.

For POST, PUT and DELETE requests you must pass these parameters along in the body instead of the query parameters. Body parameters may be encoded in one of two ways. The usual way is with key-values pairs using "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded":

[code]
curl -u "$login:$api_key" -X PUT "https://testbooru.donmai.us/posts/6.json" -d 'post[rating]=s&post[tag_string]=danboo'
[/code]

Parameters may also be encoded as JSON using "Content-Type: application/json":

[code]
curl -u "$login:$api_key" -X PUT "https://testbooru.donmai.us/posts/6.json" -d '{ "post": { "rating": "s", "tag_string": "danboo" } }' -H "Content-Type: application/json" 
[/code]

h1. Responses

All API calls that change state will return a single element response (for XML calls). They are formatted like this:

[code]
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<response success="false" reason="duplicate"/>
[/code]

For JSON responses, they'll look like this:

[code]
{ "success": false, "reason": "duplicate" }
[/code]

While you can usually determine success or failure based on the response object, you can also figure out what happened based on the HTTP status code. In addition to the standard ones, Danbooru uses some custom status codes in the 4xx and 5xx range.

* [b]200 OK[/b]: Request was successful
* [b]204 No Content[/b]: Request was successful (returned by create actions)
* [b]400 Bad Request[/b]: The given parameters could not be parsed
* [b]401 Unauthorized[/b]: Authentication failed
* [b]403 Forbidden[/b]: Access denied (see [[help:users]] for permissions information)
* [b]404 Not Found[/b]: Not found
* [b]410 Gone[/b]: Pagination limit (see [[help:users]] for pagination limits)
* [b]420 Invalid Record[/b]: Record could not be saved
* [b]422 Locked[/b]: The resource is locked and cannot be modified
* [b]423 Already Exists[/b]: Resource already exists
* [b]424 Invalid Parameters[/b]: The given parameters were invalid
* [b]429 User Throttled[/b]: User is throttled, try again later (see [[help:users]] for API limits)
* [b]500 Internal Server Error[/b]: A database timeout, or some unknown error occurred on the server
* [b]502 Bad Gateway[/b]: Server cannot currently handle the request, try again later (returned during heavy load)
* [b]503 Service Unavailable[/b]: Server cannot currently handle the request, try again later (returned during downbooru)

h1. Authentication

You will need an API key if you need to login using the API. You can generate an API key by visiting your "user profile":/profile and clicking the Generate API key button.

To authenticate with the API, pass the [code]login[/code] and [code]api_key[/code] URL parameters, where [code]login[/code] is your username and [code]api_key[/code] is your API key:

[code]
https://danbooru.donmai.us/profile.json?login=your_username&api_key=your_api_key
[/code]

You can also authenticate using "HTTP Basic Authentication":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication]:

[code]
curl "https://$username:$api_key@danbooru.donmai.us/profile.json"
curl --user "$username:$api_key" https://danbooru.donmai.us/profile.json
[/code]

Most HTTP libraries support HTTP basic authentication out of the box. If yours doesn't, you can generate the authentication header manually. The format is [code]Authentication: Basic $secret[/code] where [code]$secret = base64($username + ":" + $api_key)[/code]. In other words, concatenate your username and API key together, separated by a colon, then "Base64":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64 encode the result:

[code]
curl --header "Authorization: Basic $(printf "%s" "$username:$api_key" | base64)" https://danbooru.donmai.us/profile.json
[/code]

If you are writing a user script for a browser, you do not need to embed an API key. You can rely on the user's session.

⚠️ [b]IMPORTANT![/b] Keep your API key secret. Treat it like a password. Gaining access to it allows full access to your account. Do not publicly post your API key or distribute it in scripts.

h1. Rate Limits
There's a global rate limit  on read requests of 10 requests per second regardless of account or endpoint.

Most kinds of update actions are rate limited according to user level:

* Basic users: 1 update/second
* Gold users and above: 4 updates/second

Each rate-limited endpoint has a burst pool, which lets a user make several consecutive updates before being rate limited. The rate at which the pool is recharged depends on the endpoint, but most follow the rates above.

The burst pool size, recharge rate, and current limits are returned as JSON in the [code]x-rate-limit[/code] HTTP header. They can also be found at "/rate_limits":[/rate_limits], which shows the limits as of the last API call (the page won't update until the API is used again).

Rate limits are shared between accounts and IP addresses: multiple accounts with the same IP address will share the same rate limit.

h1. Queries

h4. Common Search Parameters

All search endpoints support a common set of parameters:

* [b]page[/b] Returns the given page. Subject to maximum page limits (see [[help:users]]).
              You can also use [code]b<id>[/code] and [code]a<id>[/code] to request results before <id> or after <id>, respectively.
              E.g. to get a page of posts before post #999999, you'd make a request to [code]/posts.json?page=b999999[/code].
* [b]limit[/b] The number of results to return per page. The maximum limit is 200 for /posts.json and 1000 for everything else.
* [b]search[id][/b]
* [b]search[created_at][/b]
* [b]search[updated_at][/b]
* [b]search[order]=custom[/b] Returns results in the same order as given by [code]search[id]=3,2,1[/code].

h5. Parameter Parsing

Numeric search parameters support ranges:

* [code]100[/code]
* [code]>100[/code]
* [code]>=100[/code]
* [code]<100[/code]
* [code]<=100[/code]
* [code]100,200,300[/code]
* [code]100..200[/code] (inclusive)

Date parameters also support ranges:

* [code]2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]>2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]>=2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]<2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]<=2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]2012-01-01,2012-01-02[/code]
* [code]2012-01-01..2013-01-01[/code] (inclusive)

Boolean parameters accept any of the following values for true or false:

* True: true, t, yes, y, on, 1
* False: false, f, no, n, off, 0

Most string parameters support using asterisks ([code]*[/code]) as wildcards. Wildcards can be escaped with [code]\*[/code]. Literal backslashes can be escaped with [code]\\[/code]. 

h1. Versioned Types

* [[API:Artists]]
* [[API:Artist commentaries]]
* [[API:Notes]]
* [[API:Pools]]
* [[API:Posts]]
* [[API:Wiki Pages]]

h2. Type Versions

* [[API:Artist versions]]
* [[API:Artist commentary versions]]
* [[API:Note versions]]
* [[API:Pool versions]]
* [[API:Post versions]]
* [[API:Wiki page versions]]

h2. Non-versioned Types

* [[API:Bulk update requests]]
* [[API:Comments]]
* [[API:Dmails]]
* [[API:Forum posts]]
* [[API:Forum topics]]
* [[API:Post appeals]]
* [[API:Post flags]]
* [[API:Tags]]
* [[API:Tag aliases]]
* [[API:Tag implications]]
* [[API:Uploads]]
* [[API:Users]]

h2. Other Functions

[expand=Related Tags]

h3. Show

The base URL is GET /related_tag.json.

* [b]query[/b] REQUIRED The tag to find the related tags for.
* [b]category[/b] If specified, show only tags of a specific category. Can be: general, artist, copyright, character, meta

[/expand]

title: princess_daisy_(toadstool_tour)
body:
[[Princess Daisy]] wearing her attire from [i]Mario Golf: Toadstool Tour[/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Top[/b]: A [[sleeveless]], bright [[yellow shirt]]. In the center of her chest is a decorative daisy emblem, similar to her [[earrings]], with a teal gemstone in the middle.
* [b]Bottoms[/b]: [[Short shorts|Short]] [[orange shorts|orange athletic shorts]] with [[yellow trim]] at the waist and leg openings.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: [[White socks|White]] [[ankle socks]].
* [b]Footwear[/b]: [[Orange shoes]] with a bright yellow toe cap.

Notably, this outfit has extensive use outside of its debut game, appearing in [i][[Mario Power Tennis]][/i], [i][[Mario Superstar Baseball]][/i], [i][[Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games (2007)|Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games]][/i], and many other spin-off titles.

title: blazar_stone
body: The collectible items from [[Ultraman Blazar (series)|]].

title: ultraman_victory
body:
The secondary Ultra of [[Ultraman Ginga S]]. His human host is Shou. 
He is the guardian of an underground race of people called the Victorians and the guardian of the Victorium Stone. He transforms using the Victory Lancer and uses Spark Dolls to access the power of monsters via his signature ability of Ultlance.

h4. Forms

* [[Ultraman Ginga Victory]] (shared with [[Ultraman Ginga|Ginga]])
* [[Ultraman Victory Knight]]
other_names: ウルトラマンビクトリー

title: ultraman_victory_knight
body:
An [[alternate color|alternate form]] for [[Ultraman Victory]], introduced in the [[Ultraman Ginga S]] spin-off, [i]Ultra Fight Victory[/i].

In this form, his red and black markings replaced with blue and silver and his V Crystals turned red. And his main weapon is the Knight Timbre, a sword/flute object.
other_names: ウルトラマンビクトリーナイト

title: blazar_brace
body: [[Ultraman Blazar]]'s transformation item.

title: bbb_(fate)
body:
BBB (ビィビィビィ, Byibyibyi?) is an "invincible anti-Servant robot of annihilation" created from old arenas of the Moon Cell Holy Grail War. She is an "unparalleled" mech-sized Labyrinth Robot guarding the third floor of the Sakura Labyrinth. In creating her, [[bb_(Fate)|BB]] spent two minutes going to the Near Side, collected parts and pieces of old arenas, disassembled them into an enemy program, reset it, and then programmed her own "superior thought routines" with lots of surplus memory. BBB was programmed not to leave the third floor, but Passionlip used Trash & Crush to crush her and throw her into the arena.

BBB is described by Passionlip as "self-important and uncute", and it is said she is more honest about her feelings than BB. 

BBB was planned to appear in the third chapter, but was scrapped due to not being an interesting boss.

* !post #8209906: Concept art

title: sheoldred
body:
Sheoldred, known as the Whispering One was the Praetor of the Black Faction of New Phyrexia. In the year 4562 AR, she led an invasion of the plane of Dominaria, where she attained several important military objectives in preparation for New Phyrexia's Invasion of the Multiverse. After her return to New Phyrexia, however, she lost a power struggle against the Mother of Machines, [[Elesh_Norn]]. Sheoldred was subsequently captured by Norn's forces and beheaded by [[Ajani_Goldmane]].

https://mtg.fandom.com/wiki/Sheoldred

body:
Brisela was created from the broken bodies and minds of [[bruna_light_of_alabaster|Bruna]] and [[gisela_blade_of_goldnight|Gisela]]. Once two of the most powerful angels on Innistrad, they were conscripted by [[emrakul_the_aeons_torn|Emrakul]] and are now melded together to serve as the Eldrazi titan's messenger.

title: gomen_yui
body:
A catchphrase that later evolved into a [[meme]] that was originally said by [[Makoto_(princess_connect!)|]] during the [i]Maho Maho Kingdom[/i] in-game [[Princess Connect! Re:Dive]] event, expressing regret for falling in love with [[yuuki_(princess_connect!)|Yuuki]], despite her best friend Yui also being in love with the same person. 

Use this tag if any [[princess_connect!|Princess Connect!]] characters expresses guilt or regret towards [[yui_(princess_connect!)|Yui]] for [[netorare|taking]] [[reverse netorare|away]] Yuuki (the usual suspects are the aforementioned Makoto, [[kasumi_(princess_connect!)|Kasumi]], [[hiyori_(princess_connect!)|Hiyori]], and [[rei_(princess_connect!)|Rei]]), if Yui is visibly upset or jealous of Yuuki doing something with someone else, or if the phrase itself appeared in the image in any form (usually by swapping Yui with other characters).

h4. See also
* [[Gomen Yuuka]]

title: netorare
body:
A fetish in which someone close to the protagonist is either willingly or unwillingly seduced and stolen away. This isn't necessarily limited to one's lover, but may also include friends, unrequited love interests, or even relatives.

Closely related is netori/netoru (寝取り/寝取る). In this genre, the protagonist instead takes the lover of someone else. Also related is cuckolding, in which seeking out others is actively encouraged, even at the expense of the cuckold.

Posts on Danbooru should include the presence of the cheated on in some form, physical or otherwise (such as on the phone, as is common), or mentioned at some significant length. Do not apply this tag if only the artist's commentary mentioned that it was NTR-themed posts but other sign of it being such shown in the image itself (such as the "cuckolded" character being absent).

See [[reverse netorare]] for a situation where the victim of a netorare situation is a woman.

Not to be confused with [[cheating (relationship)]], which is when one party intentionally approached the third party without their partner's consent.

h4. Example
* !post #5474225:  Regular netorare
* !post #6636786: [[Reverse netorare]]

h4. See Also
* [[netorase]]

title: ground_gundam
body:
A [[mobile suit]] from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

The [b]RX-79[G] Gundam Ground Type[/b] are the [[mobile suit]]s used by the the protagonists of [[Gundam 08th MS Team]]. It later became a popular addition in other Gundam video games and manga such as [[Gundam Lost War Chronicles]].

The Ground Gundam is a less powerful but easier to repair and produce version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] prototype created by the [[Earth Federation]]. It has the same color scheme as the RX-78-2 but there are key differences between the two. It has a yellow V-shaped head fin, no beam sabers on its backpack, a single vulcan gun mounted on its torso, and a different short [[shield]].

title: luigi_(super_rush)
body: [[Luigi]] wearing his golf attire from [i][[Mario Golf: Super Rush]][/i]. This outfit consists of green short-sleeved zip-up golf polo, a green visor-style cap, pleated white pants, a blue belt, a single white golf glove, and white golf shoes.

title: takamachi_nanoha
body:
The main character of [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha]] and its sequels, [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's]] and [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha StrikerS]]. 

Her [[magical girl]] outfit has the color scheme of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. This, and her propensity for huge pink lasers of doom, led fans to call her the [[White Devil]].

Her Intelligent Device is known as [[Raising Heart]].

She is voiced by [[Tamura Yukari]].

title: full_armor_gundam
body:
A manned [[mobile suit]] from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. 

Making its entrance in [[Gundam Thunderbolt]], the [b]FA-78 Full Armor Gundam[/b] is a massive series of upgrades to the [[Earth Federation]] [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]], with a new dark-blue paint job, four extra manipulator arms carrying shields, a twin-barreled beam rifle, and missile launchers at every corner, as well as the extra added armor, which can be ditched if need be, and extra boosters to aid in mobility. It was piloted by the brash and reckless [[Io Fleming]], who as usual, blared freestyle jazz through its communicator as he announced his presence to the battlefield.

Not to be mistaken for the FA-78-1 Full Armor Gundam from the MSV series, which is a vastly different MS.
other_names: フルアーマーガンダム(サンダーボルト)
フルアーマー・ガンダム(サンダーボルト版)

title: gundam_ex
body:
A manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam Requiem for Vengeance]] [[Netflix]] series from 2024.

The [b]Gundam EX[/b] is a rare early [[ground_gundam|ground variant]] of the [[Earth Federation]] [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]. [b]EX[/b]tremely fast, powerful and resilient, it was designed for newtype use [b]EX[/b]clusively.

title: iced_coffee
body:
Brewed [[coffee]] served cold over [[ice]]. A popular beverage during hot [[summer]] months.

Unlike cold brew coffee which is brewed at cold temperatures over a long time, iced coffee is prepared hot and then chilled.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: unicorn_gundam
body:
A manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. 

The titular [[mecha]] (and plot device) from [[Gundam Unicorn]] (2010). The [b]RX-0 Unicorn Gundam[/b] is the "key" to Laplace's Box, a MacGuffin purported to contain a secret that could overthrow the Earth Federation government. Possession of the Unicorn Gundam is therefore hotly disputed, as it also acts as a map to the Box by way of a "La+ program" installed in its operating system.

Its physical design is a throwback to the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], being a "white [[mobile suit]]" armed with a set of beam sabers mounted behind its head, a beam rifle with power equivalent to that of a battleship class beam weapon, and a shield with a viewport. It also incorporates concepts from its chronological predecessor, the [[Nu Gundam]], by adapting the Nu Gundam's cockpit-lined [[Psycho Frame]] throughout its entire body (visible in [[NT-D]] mode) and having the ability to use [[funnels (gundam)|]] or bits (though it requires the NT-D to be active and the enemy to have said remote weapons so the Unicorn could hijack them).

[spoiler] Upon its awakening, the Unicorn Gundam also gains abilities similar to the Nu Gundam's: The Shield Funnels (Unicorn Gundam's shields with a beam gatling gun attached on each), which has both offensive and defensive capabilities not unlike the [[Fin Funnels]] and the ability to create a phenomena similar to the Axis Shock. [/spoiler]

Piloted by [[Banagher Links]]. Designed by [[Katoki Hajime]].

The Unicorn Gundam's popularity led to a 1:1 statue of it, with partial Unicorn Mode to Destroy Mode transformation, to replace the original Gundam statue in Diver City, Odaiba, Tokyo.

h4. Other variants

* [[Unicorn Gundam Banshee]]
* [[Unicorn Gundam Phenex]]

title: bubble_tea
body:
Bubble tea (also known as "pearl milk tea", "tapioca tea", "boba tea", or simply "boba") is a type of [[tea]]-based [[drink]] invented in Taiwan. It consists of a mixture of tea, milk, or other flavorings, plus small black tapioca balls ("boba") that float at the bottom of the drink. The drink usually comes with an extra-large [[drinking_straw|straw]], used to suck up and chew the tapioca balls.

In 2019, bubble tea experienced a sudden boom in popularity in Japan, with a corresponding rise in fanart featuring the drink.

h4. See also

* [[Bubble tea challenge]]
* [[Disposable cup]]
* [[Iced tea]]

h4. External links

* "The Japan Times: Tokyo's tapioca boom":[https://www.japantimes.co.jp/life/2019/05/11/food/tokyos-tapioca-boom-find-bubble-tea-capital/]
* "Wikipedia: Bubble tea":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bubble_tea]
other_names: タピオカミルクティー

title: lemonade
body:
A cool beverage made out of squeezed [[lemon|lemons]] and [[granulated sugar|sugar]].  Basic lemonade is typically a pale yellowish color, with commercial varieties having a more vibrant yellow color.  Other juices or dyes may be added to create other variety of lemonades, such as pink lemonade.
h4.See also

* [[Ramune]]
* [[Iced tea]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: caterpillar_tracks
body:
A continuous track running between drive wheels, intended to give the vehicle greater off-road capability. Commonly used on on [[tank|tanks]], [[half-track|half-tracks]], as well as some [[bulldozer|bulldozer]]s, [[excavator]]s and farm [[tractor]]s.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Continuous track":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuous_track

title: g-3_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It is a [[mobile suit]] from [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]'s novelization of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]].

The [b]RX-78-3 Gundam Unit 3 "G03"[/b] is visually identical to the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] except for the G-3's grey and blue color scheme. The blue may be absent in some depictions.

title: 0_gundam
body:
[[Mecha]] from [[Gundam 00]]. Resembles the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] from the first [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series.

The [b]GN-000 0 Gundam[/b] is the first Gundam developed by Celestial Being and the basis for the future [[GN Drive]] powered Gundams to be developed. It is piloted by [[Ribbons Almark]].

Designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]], who is also the designer of the RX-78-2.
other_names: フルアーマー0ガンダム

title: ribbons_almark
body:
Main antagonist of [[Gundam 00]]. He is the leader of the [[Innovators (Gundam 00)|]] and pilot of the [[0 Gundam]] and the [[Reborns Gundam]].

He is a walking reference to [[Amuro Ray]] from the Universal Century timeline. Aside from sharing the same [[voice actor]] ([[Furuya Tooru]]), their respective [[mobile suits]] also greatly resemble each other: 0 Gundam and [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]; Reborns Gundam and [[Hi-Nu Gundam]]. 

Due to those similarities, as well as Ribbons' role as a villain, fans nickname him as "Evil Amuro", with his 0 Gundam being called as "Evil RX-78-2" after the reveal that he is the pilot of said MS.
other_names: リボンズ・アルマーク

title: heavy_full_armor_gundam
body:
A [[mobile suit]] from [[Gundam MSV]].

The [b]FA-78-1 Full Armor Gundam[/b] is a variant of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] equipped with extra armor plates, missile launchers, a twin barreled beam rifle and even a huge shoulder mounted rocket launcher. It was developed into the [[Heavy Gundam]].

Not to be mistaken for the FA-78 [[Full Armor Gundam]] from [[Gundam Thunderbolt]] - a vastly different machine.
other_names: フルアーマーガンダム(MSV)
ガンダムフルアーマータイプ

title: zz_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise.

The [[AEUG]] [b]MSZ-010 ZZ Gundam[/b] (pronounced "Double Zeta" and codenamed "θ Gundam" or "Theta Gundam") is the titular [[mobile suit]] of [[gundam_zz|Mobile Suit ZZ Gundam]].

The unit is also transformable, turning into its [i]G-Fortress mode[/i], like its predecessor [[Zeta Gundam (mobile_suit)|]], equipped with the Core Block System like the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], and armed with heavy beam weaponry. However, its highly destructive arsenal needs a high output of power, draining its power especially when it fires its Hyper Mega Cannon.

This mobile suit is mainly piloted by [[Gundam Team]] leader [[Judau Ashta]].

title: nu_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. The lead Gundam featured in the film [[Char's Counterattack]].

The [b]RX-93 Nu Gundam[/b] was one of the most advanced [[mobile suit]]s of its time in U.C. 0093, together with [[Char Aznable]]'s [[sazabi|MSN-04 Sazabi]]. Both mobile suits are equipped with the revolutionary [[Psycho Frame]] technology.

The Nu Gundam's design is unique as it doesn't follow the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]'s signature color scheme unlike its predecessors, the [[Zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam]] and [[ZZ Gundam|MSZ-010 ZZ Gundam]] and sports a white, black (or midnight blue) and yellow color scheme instead, has a mouthpiece with three vents as opposed to the standard two vents, is equipped with a pair of different [[energy sword|beam sabers]] with different mounting places (the larger beam saber is mounted on the backpack, near and behind the right shoulder and the smaller one is mounted on the left forearm) and also the first lead Gundam to be equipped with [[funnels (gundam)|remote weapons]] called the [[Fin Funnels]], which gives it its asymmetrical design when the funnels are docked. 

It is piloted and designed in-universe by [[Amuro Ray]]. In real life, it is designed by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]]. In 2021, a life size replica of the Nu Gundam was announced for a Spring 2022 opening in Fukuoka. This version of the suit features an altered design and is referred to as the [[Nu Gundam (rx-93ff)|RX-93FF Nu Gundam]].

h4. See also

* [[Sazabi]]
* [[Hi-Nu Gundam]]
* [[Unicorn Gundam]]

title: gundam_gt-four
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MS Generation]].

The [b]RX-78E Gundam GT-FOUR[/b] is an experimental prototype variable geometry [[mobile suit]] developed from the original [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] by the [[Earth Federation]] during the final days of The One Year War.

While the project was abandoned and the mecha was never mass produced, knowledge obtained from it greatly served for the successful development of future more advanced variable MS like the [[Asshimar]] and the [[Gaplant]] several years later.

title: gundam_g04
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

The [b]RX-78-4 Gundam Unit 4 "G04"[/b] is the fourth Gundam [[mobile suit]] unit produced during the One Year War. A space oriented version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], Unit 4 possessed a different backpack with more powerful [[thrusters]] and the mighty Mega Beam Launcher - a colossal, massively destructive weapon that required the suit's total output to be fired, which rendered it completely immobile during firing.

title: v_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]].

The [b]LM312V04 Victory Gundam[/b] is a small but powerful combining [[mobile suit]] developed by the League Militaire to fend off the ever so present threat of the cruel [[Zanscare]] Empire. Its resemblance to the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] gave the type its name. While many pilots took to its controls, the most known and lethal of them was, oddly, a 13 year old boy named [[Uso Ewin]].

Upgraded into the [[V2 Gundam]] configuration.
other_names: ヴィクトリーガンダム

title: freedom_gundam
body:
The [b]ZGMF-X10A Freedom Gundam[/b] is a nuclear powered [[mobile suit]] developed by ZAFT for long-ranged high speed combat, owing to its armaments and its 10-winged design. Its trademark feature is the "Full Burst Mode", the ability to take down multiple enemies in one full volley of its weapons.

It is designed as the companion unit of the [[Justice Gundam]], and is piloted by [[Kira Yamato]].

Owing to its popularity, the Freedom Gundam is one of four machines from the Gundam universe to have a 1:1 scale statue in the real world - in this case, in Shanghai, China - alongside the [[Unicorn Gundam]], the [[Nu Gundam]], and the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]].

title: gundam_alex
body:
A [[mobile suit]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 0080]] OVA in the 1980s.
 
The [b]RX-78NT-1 Gundam "Alex"[/b] is a vastly upgraded version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], as the original machine was already showing signs of obsolescence and simply couldn't keep up with the speed of [[Amuro Ray]]'s Newtype reflexes. It possessed a "Chobham":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chobham_armour [[Reactive Armor]] package, hidden 90mm wrist guns, a redesigned [[beam rifle]], and was much faster and possessed greater maneuverability thanks to extra [[thrusters]]. 

It was piloted in testing by [[Christina Mackenzie]], who successfully repealed a [[Zeon]] assault on the colony the test facility was located in, defeating the powerful but weakly armored [[kampfer_(mobile_suit)|Kämpfer]] before [spoiler]being totaled in a brutal brawl with [[Bernard Wiseman]]'s [[Zaku II FZ Kai]] which resulted in his death, neither having figured out that the pilot of the enemy machine was the other.[/spoiler]

title: gundam_rock
body:
[b]Gundam Rock[/b] is a cover album by hard rock musician [[Andrew WK]] released on September 9, 2009 only in Japan. The album consists of covered music from the original soundtrack of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] (the first Gundam series), but with English translated lyrics and vocals. It was released to celebrate the 30th Anniversary of the [[Gundam]] franchise that started in 1979.

The front cover artwork features an original illustration by respected Gundam and [[Capcom]] artist, [[Yasuda Akira]] (also known as "Akiman"). The image depicts Andrew W.K. floating in space next to the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] in similar fashion to [[Amuro Ray]] in one of the official posters of the [[Char's Counterattack]] movie.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Gundam Rock":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gundam_Rock

title: mazinger_z_(mecha)
body:
[b]Mazinger Z[/b] (also known as [b]Tranzor Z[/b]) is the titular [[super robot]] [[mecha]] from the [[Mazinger Z]] [[science fiction]] series by [[Nagai Gou]].

It is piloted by [[Kabuto Kouji]] and is armed with photonic laser rays in its eyes, "breast fire" thermal chest rays, a supersonic and corroding "hurricane" wind generator in its mouth, missiles, the "[[rocket punch]]" and super strength. 

Mazinger can fly, travel underwater and is constructed from a special, almost indestructible alloy called [i]Super Alloy Z[/i]. 

The titanic robot was created by Doctor [[Kabuto Juuzou]] ([[Kabuto Kouji]]'s grandfather) to combat [[Doctor Hell|Dr. Hell]] and his Mechanical Beasts, who desired the metal for their own nefarious purposes.

Mazinger Z is notable because it was the first piloted giant robot in the history of anime. According to Nagai, the idea of a manned robot came from one occasion when he was stuck in very heavy traffic inside a very small red car and he imagined it producing wings on its sides (like the [[pilder]] [[aircraft]]) and a giant robot body so it could walk above the other cars.  

The [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] was one of the many subsequent manned mecha inspired by this popular classic super robot.

h4. See also

* [[Pilder]]

title: mobile_suit_guntank
body:
A fan made [[alternate universe]] [[parody]] of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] created by [[Nippori Honsha]].

In this version a hot headed, strong-willed and aggressive [[Hayato Kobayashi]] and his [[Guntank]] are the main protagonist of the story, while a meek, weak minded and bespectacled, deeply intellectual [[Amuro Ray]] and his [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] are side characters.

title: g-armor
body: A heavy armored and armed variant of the [[Core Fighter]], the [b]G-Armor[/b] is the combined form of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] with parts of the the [[G-Fighter]].

title: last_shooting
body: The iconic pose of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] before its mutual destruction with the [[Zeong]], firing a shot from its [[beam rifle]] straight up into the air, often while [[damaged]] and missing its head and an arm.
other_names: ラストシューティング

title: rx-78f00
body: The life-size moving [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mecha]] in Yokohama. Due to the logistics of building a life-sized mecha attraction, there are some slight changes in the design from the original, and [[gunpla]] based on the real life statue are released with this name.

title: pauline_(tennis_aces)_(mario)
body: [[Pauline (Mario)|Pauline]] wearing her tennis attire from [i][[Mario Tennis Aces]][/i]. This outfit consists of a halter style sleeveless red tennis dress, a matching red visor, a white and yellow wristband, and black and white tennis shoes.

title: core_fighter
body:
A type of one-man [[starfighter]] from the [[Gundam]] universe. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series from 1979.

While there are dozens of different [b]Core Fighters[/b] - usually being a different model for each machine they are mated to - they all serve roughly the same purpose: forming the center of the [[Mobile Suit]], as part of the Core Block System, and acting as an escape pod in the worst case scenario.

h4. See also

* [[Core Booster]]
* [[G-Fighter]]
* [[G-Armor]]

title: adzam
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.

[b]MAX-03 Adzam[/b]

The first [[mobile armor]] fielded by the Principality of [[Zeon]] during "The One Year War". A massive combat [[walker (robot)]], it featured multiple twin-barreled mega-particle cannons on its vaguely onion shaped body as well as the unique "Leader" anti-mobile suit weapon. 

One unit fought the [[rx-78-2 gundam]] at the Odessa mining division base while a second unit would be encountered and destroyed by a [[Ground Gundam]] during the Battle of Odessa. A third and possibly final unit was encountered and destroyed by the White Dingo team in Australia.

title: kamihama_university_affiliated_school_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden|Magia Record]], worn by the students of the Kamihama University Affliated School in Kamihama City.

It's a [[serafuku]] which consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[breast pocket]]s, a [[red sailor collar|red]] [[sailor shirt|sailor collar]], [[black sleeves|black]] [[short over long sleeves]], an [[aqua ribbon|aqua]] or [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[plaid_skirt|plaid]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with [[buttons]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

h4. Notable Students

* [[Aino Mito]] (pairs it with [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Akino Kaede]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thighhighs]])
* [[Haruna Konomi]] (changes the black sleeves into [[brown sleeves|brown]] ones and loafers into [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[ankle boots]]; additionally accessorizes with [[white socks|white]] [[ankle socks]].
* [[Ibuki Leila]] (pairs it with [[grey thighhighs]])
* [[Isuzu Ren]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs]])
* [[Kisaki Emiri]] (changes the regular neck ribbon into an [[aqua necktie|aqua]] [[necktie]] and changes black sleeves into [[pink sleeves|pink]] ones that are [[sleeves rolled up|rolled up]]; additionally accessorizes with [[button badge]]s, [[bracelet]]s and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Kumi Seika]] (pairs it with [[brown socks|brown]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Minagi Sasara]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs]])
* [[Minami Rena]] (changes the regular neck ribbon into a [[plaid bowtie|plaid]] [[blue bowtie|blue]] [[bowtie]], pairs it with [[white thighhighs]])
* [[Nanami Yachiyo]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs]])
* [[Natsume Kako]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs]])
* [[Suzuka Sakuya]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs]] and a [[clothes around waist|sweater around her waist]] with [[button badge]]s)
* [[Tamaki Iroha]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs]])
* [[Tamaki Ui]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs]])
* [[Togame Momoko]] (pairs it with [[white thighhighs]])
* [[Yui Tsuruno]] (pairs it with [[black thighhighs]])

title: cfa-44_nosferatu
body:
A fictional [[fighter jet]] that appeared in [[Ace Combat 6]]. Some counterparts of the airplane appeared in [[Ace Combat Assault Horizon]] (as a DLC) and  [[Ace Combat Infinity]] (as an unmanned aircraft called [[QFA-44 Carmilla]]).
In the AC6, it was developed by Estovakia and piloted by [[Ilya Pasternak]]. It has the function to control a large number of [[unmanned aerial vehicle|UAVs]] called [[uav-45_malebolge|Malebolge]].

[[Paizuri]] where neither of the participants use their hands or arms to touch the breasts.

Contrast this with the more common type of [[paizuri]] where the breasts are guided or held still by one of the participants grabbing them.

title: gourmet_research_society_(blue_archive)
body:
The Gourmet Research Society is one of the clubs at Gehenna Academy in [[Blue Archive]].

A club centered around its leader, [[Haruna (blue archive)|]]. Their sole purpose is to sample every aspect of food. Despite the name of the club, it can be pretty troublesome even by Gehenna standards. With food being the club's priority, its members will throw themselves into trouble for the sake of it. Their motto is [b]"Eat or Die"[/b], which showcases their dedication although each member has their own taste when it comes to "good" food.

Because it is food-related, [[Fuuka (blue archive)|]] from the Gehenna Academy School Lunch Club is often the target of their attention.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

h4. Members

* [[Haruna (blue archive)|]]
* [[Junko (blue archive)|]]
* [[Izumi (blue archive)|]]
* [[Akari (blue archive)|]]
other_names: 美食研究会(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: self-propelled_artillery
body:
A motorized field artillery or anti-tank gun. The difference between it and a [[tank]] is that the latter is a versatile support vehicle designed to help infantry, while a self-propelled gun is a mobile gun with a single purpose. A [[tank destroyer]] is technically a self-propelled gun but because of the similarity to a normal [[tank]], they tend to be grouped under tanks.

Anti-tank self-propelled guns generally have the gun mounted to the chassis itself in a [[turretless tank|turretless]] design (like the German Stug/Stuh or Russian SU-series of guns). Artillery pieces are more varied in design and can have a turret or an exposed cannon. 

This only applies to artillery pieces with a cannon; mobile rocket launchers are not covered by this term.

h4. See also

* [[Jagdpanther]]
* [[M7 Priest]]
* [[Marder III]]
* [[Panzerhaubitze 2000]]
* [[Sturmgeschutz III]]
* [[SU-152]]
* [[SU-122]]
* [[list of ground vehicles]]

title: jagdtiger
body:
[b]Jagdtiger[/b] ("Hunting Tiger") is the common name of a German heavy [[tank destroyer]] of [[World War II]]. The official German designation was [b]Panzerjäger Tiger Ausf. B[/b] as it was based on a lengthened [[Tiger II]] chassis. The 71-tonne Jagdtiger was the heaviest armored fighting vehicle used operationally during [[World War II]] and is the heaviest armored vehicle of any type to achieve series production. The vehicle carried a 128 mm PaK 44 L/55 main gun, capable of out-ranging and defeating any fielded Allied [[tank]].

However, the tank suffered from a similar overweight issue with its base model, which is further exacerbated by the front-heavy centre of gravity. Resulted in a frequent brakedowns that added further strains on stuggling German logistics. The vehicle's increased weight also cause it to be even more underpowered and slower than the base model.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jagdtiger":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jagdtiger
* "GuP website: Jagdpanzer VI 'Jagdtiger'":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_bla_jt_s10.html

title: jagdpanther
body:
The Jagdpanther ("hunting panther") was a [[tank destroyer]] built by [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] during [[World War II]] based on the chassis of the [[Panther (tank)|]] (Panther). The Jagdpanther combined the very powerful 8.8 cm PaK 43 cannon of the [[Tiger II]] and the characteristically excellent armor and suspension of the Panther chassis.

body:

h4.See also

title: sukiyaki
body:
A type of [[nabe]] dish, cooked over a direct fire at the table in a nabe hot pot.

Sukiyaki contains thinly-sliced [[beef]], green vegetables, [[mushroom]]s, [[tofu]], [[spring onion]], and (often) [[noodles]], in a [[soy sauce]], [[granulated sugar]], mirin, and [[sake]] cooking broth. It is usually served with raw [[egg]] for dipping.

Also known as [i]gyuunabe[/i] (beef nabe).

h4. See also

* [[Nabe]]
* [[Oden]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukiyaki 
* "Pixpedia article (eng)":http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/Sukiyaki
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: coffee
body:
A hot [[drink]] that is made by filtering hot water through ground [[coffee beans]], popular for its aroma and concentrated dose of caffeine. Use this tag when coffee itself (ordinarily a black or dark brown liquid) is visible in an image.

It is normally served in a porcelain [[coffee mug]], but it can be taken on the go in a stainless steel mug, styrofoam cup, or in a paper [[disposable coffee cup]]. For the traditional porcelain or ceramic "coffee cups" that aren't mug-shaped, see [[teacup]].

As coffee can be quite bitter, it is often served accompanied by [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and [[milk]] or [[cream]]. It is usually consumed while hot, but it may be served over ice.

title: miramikaru_riran
body:
An original character for the [[Touhou]] voice drama あやつり異変 (Ayatsuri Ihen) that was made with Flipnote Gallery: World and popularized by [[manatsu_no_yo_no_inmu|Inmu]]/[[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]] fans. The author [[Riina (cookie)|]] was in elementary school when she drew it and has since distanced herself from it. Today, Riran and [[miramikaru miran|her sister]] are mostly associated with Cookie☆.

A youkai [[fox girl|kitsune]] with the ability to drive people mad. Some jokes about her animation include drawing her with a red [[rice bowl]] or a purple seat belt or rod. She has [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]], [[red eyes]], [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] and a [[single sidelock|sidelock]] on her left. She wears an [[open vest|open]] [[brown vest]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], a [[brown skirt]], and a [[black necktie]]. Her signature spell card is called Dark Inferno. 

Riran was first criticized for being an OC in a Touhou voice drama, but people began to draw her more as time went on. This was compounded by the release of [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]] which had both a [[Junko (touhou)|fox]] and a character that [[Clownpiece|drives people mad]]. Another coincidence was [[Senko_(sewayaki_kitsune_no_senko-san)|]] who happened to look similar. Since then, Riran has become the unofficial mascot of Cookie as an independent fandom outside of Touhou.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21049467

h4. External links

* "Nicopedia: メッモー☆":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%83%A1%E3%83%83%E3%83%A2%E3%83%BC%E2%98%86
* "Nicopedia: Miramikaru Riran":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%83%9F%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9F%E3%82%AB%E3%83%AB%E3%83%AA%E3%83%A9%E3%83%B3

title: geru_futota
body:
Voice of the [[Remilia Scarlet]] Cookie fundamentalist and Star Sapphire (as [[Shunga Youkyu]]) and Izayoi Sakuya (as [[Zwei (cookie)|]]) in [[Cookie (touhou)|Self-Contradiction☆]]. Her design was based on [[Hisaka (cookie)|]], but she wears a [[military uniform]] of a [[black hat]], [[black coat]], [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], [[black necktie]], [[black skirt]], and an [[armband]] with a [[broken heart print]]. Her name is a corruption of the German "Toter Geruch", meaning "smell of death". 

Known to have Dissociative Personality Disorder and deleting her twitter and disappearing after stating her was going to commit suicide, but came back eventually before disappearing completely in 2021. Seems to actually genuinely hate everything about Cookie, going on multi-paragraph rants against the community, the actors, the directors, the doxxers, and the fan artists on 5ch and Discord.

title: yamin_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and Cirno in the original [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Cirno has since been split off to become [[Cirno (cookie)]] and should be tagged separately. The only one of the original eight to also voice in later dramas, she avoided most of the controversy as she lived in a different part of Japan and sent her recordings over the internet. 

Although one of the main characters of the original voice drama, she later got grouped into the RIM family as the "child" character to [[Kanna (cookie)|]]'s "mother" attitude. Also seen with [[Manatsu no yo no inmu|Inmu]] characters far more than the rest of the cast. Sometimes drawn with a [[katana]] as a parody of Monster Hunter. A video of her in her room during a livestream tripping over a heater became memed.

Still active an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber]] who collabs with Kanna.

title: jigen_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Kasu☆]]. Identifiable by her [[long bangs]] [[hair over eyes|over her eyes]] and [[holding gun|holding a gun]], usually a [[revolver]]. The most popular character from Kasu☆, later getting bundled into the ALC faction of characters, although she still sometimes appears with [[Koga (cookie)|]] and [[833 (cookie)|]] from their voice drama. She has completely disappeared from the internet.

Unlike other Cookie characters, her online handle isn't actually Jigen, it is Teresa. However, her frame of her with her hair over her eyes and her generally calm voice and demeanor in the voice drama led to people calling her Jigen after [[Jigen Daisuke]]. The gunslinger persona followed. She was paired with [[Ichigo (cookie)|]] as a variant of the "badass and naive" trope.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21075434

title: akira_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Yagokoro Eirin]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆]] and [[Kazami Yuuka]] in Kuso☆☆☆. More famous as Yuuka with [[messy hair]], [[large breasts]], no ascot, and [[sanpaku]]. An active voice actress and cosplayer, she maintains unusually good relations with the Cookie community and like dirty jokes. 

Because [[Macota (cookie)|]]'s Yuuka spoke fast to earn the nickname Fast Talking Oba-san, Akira's speed was even faster to earn her the nickname Super Fast Talking Oba-san. Her lines about Valentine's day is a popular copypasta. 
[code]あらアリスじゃないあなたもお買い物をしにこの店を訪れたの？この店で材料を買って、誰かに美味しいお菓子を作って贈ろうということねちなみにバレンタインデーとはかつての古代ローマの祭りを異教を認めないキリスト教圏内でも続けるためにヴァレンティヌスという架空の聖人を作り上げこれを悼むための日としたのが始まりと言われており今では恋人たちの日として世界各地で親しまれている。皆様はバレンタインデーを毎日いかがお過ごしですか

Oh my, if it isn't Alice. Did you come here to do shopping too? You wanted some ingredients so that you could make some sweets as a present for someone, right? Incidentally, Valentine of Valentine's Day was a fictional saint created so that those within the Christian circle who refused Paganism could continue the festivals of ancient Rome. It used to be a day of lament for Saint Valentine, but now it is more familiar known around the world as a day for lovers. Has everyone been spending their Valentine's Day well this year?[/code]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21073120
* !asset #21073121

title: nyon_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Nazrin]] and [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and artist in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆]], almost exclusively appearing as Nazrin. Atouda let her play Nazrin since the original voice was unavailable and Nazrin was Nyon's favorite Touhou character. Briefly was a [[virtual youtuber]] named [[Suzukiri Iro]] before retiring after the Cookie fans' attention was too much. Her unique voice and cute appearance skyrocketed her popularity.

Since she was the main person [[Ichigo (cookie)|]] interacted with during her most popular scene, Nyon became famous by association and also created a staggering amount of memes.
* "Nai desu": "Don't have it". Nazrin's response to Alice asking for ingredients (eggs, [[flour (cookie)|]], and [[milk (cookie)|]]) for baking. By far her most popular line, endlessly remixed and parodied. 
* "I also like Nazrin, Kogasa, and Nue. I like them all.": Her most famous line from a post-voice drama interview. She stressed the Nu in Nue, which became parodied as a very weird way of saying it. 
* NYN Bee and NYN Egg: In a [[bee costume]] and an [[egg costume]]. MAD material that became "canon" after the original artist of Nyon drew them. 
* [[Fake Nyon (cookie)|]]: An impersonator that achieved a decent level of fame. 
* Egg: To match Flour and Milk (and [[Butter (cookie)|]]). A taller, white skinned version of her drawn by her second artist. Sometimes treated as a separate character.
* "Atamawaruwaru": "Are you retarded?" A MAD material of her dancing set to the Honobono Shrine remix of Dichromatic Lotus Butterfly that went extremely viral
* "Anone, anone, [[crossbone_gundam|Crossbone]] will never be animated. I'd rather see [[gundam_hathaway's_flash|Hathaway's Flash]] animated than Crossbone.": Famous for both the first two words and the accurate prediction of Hathaway's Flash getting an adaptation in 2021 while Crossbone remains manga only.
* NYN Eevees: Drawing the [[eevee]]lutions as Nyons.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21074143

title: kain_r_heinlein
body:
The main villain of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. 

Following a poor upbringing alongside his brother [[Grant (SNK)|Abel, a.k.a. Grant]], and sister Marie, Kain swore to gain power at all costs. After the death of South Town's infamous crime lord [[Geese Howard]], Kain would ultimately gain power and take his place as the ruler of South Town's underworld. To prove his might, he hosted the latest edition of South Town's legendary King of Fighters martial arts tournament - The King of Fighters: Maximum Mayhem. He claims to be the uncle of [[Rock Howard]], as his sister Marie was a lover of Geese's. Though Rock long believed his mother Marie was dead, Kain claims she is indeed alive, convincing Rock to work with him for a time.

Kain returns in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], with [[Vox Reaper]] taking Grant's place as his new enforcer.

title: akatsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akatsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] that can be fairly [[messy_hair|messy]], and usually has a tuft of [[hair_between_eyes|hair between her eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Special-Type's [[serafuku]] ([[white shirt]], [[black sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]), but with [[black pantyhose]], a [[flat cap]], and the "III" badge on the left side of her collar.

She does her best to act like a true lady and thus doesn't like to be [[age_conscious|treated as a child]], especially in regards to [[headpat]]ting. Her protests that she is a "full-fledged lady" or "first-class lady" have become something of a catchphrase: [[ichininmae no lady]]. This has the side effect of making her look even more childish. Many characters enjoy teasing her by doing things that play upon her being childish, such as giving her [[okosama_lunch|children's meals]].

title: roma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Roma[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], and [[brown eyes]] with [[pince-nez]] [[glasses]]. 

Her default outfit is similar to her sister [[Littorio (Kancolle)|]]: a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with additional [[detached sleeves]] and a [[white capelet]], [[grey corset]], [[red skirt]], [[white thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and red horizontal stripes, [[white hat|white]] [[headdress]], and grey-green [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is a split hull with the [[Regia Marina]]'s historic red-white bow stripes, her three 381 mm triple gun mounts, and additional [[anti-aircraft gun]]s at kai form.

Historically, [i]Roma[/i] was sunk by the [[Luftwaffe]] as she, her sister-ships and other units in the Italian fleet attempted to sail to Malta to surrender to the British. Because of her real-life counterpart's fate, she is often portrayed as having a grudge toward German ship girls.

h4. Appearance

title: maestrale_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Maestrale[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[green eyes]], and a [[tan]] skin with visible [[tanlines]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with her real-life hull code, striped [[red neckerchief]] with an [[anchor]] clip, [[striped panties]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and propellers to her back, connecting her two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and 120 mm twin gun mounts, [[paravane]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her real-life fire control director as a [[mini hat]]. Her kai form includes a third 120 mm single gun mount on the funnel.
